page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Farming. Until twenty years ago, some farmers used horses and employed teams of men. In recent years there has been a switch to greater cereal production. This, and mechanisation has meant that far fewer men are employed in farming. The old pattern of small mixed farms has changed. Only one working farm remains in Nawton and two in Wombleton. Some villages have smallholdings and do some part-time farming. Land is gradually been bought up by large landowners. One major landowner has begun to let farmhouses which were once tenanted as holiday homes. This landowner has retained the land and turned it over to cereal production and contractors are employed.
